data.text:
We’ve just returned to Britain from Rhodes and the Rodos Village Hotel- a much anticipated first overseas trip as a family of four: children of nine and seven, my wife  and I. 

I can’t recommend Rodos Village highly enough, from the welcome we received as we arrived at 1am to the wonderful animation team led by Willy who provided excellent activities and evening entertainments (fire, magic and break-dancing shows) 

The layout of the hotel is memorable, built into a rocky out-crop overlooking the beach at Kiotari. The landscape means that Rodos Village would be difficult for those with mobility limitations but the steep ascents are quite handy in burning off some calories acquired at the wonderful buffet restaurant. The restaurant does get busy but there is a fantastic variety of soups, salads, main courses and puddings. The staff are friendly and attentive and work so very hard. We ate in all the Al a carte restaurants (use the Mitsis hotels app to book these beforehand) and I would particularly recommend the Greek and Italian restaurants, up the hill, near the salt-water pool, delicious food and fantastic staff. 

When we visited the temperature ranged between 25 and 27 degrees Celsius which was perfect for an Autumn getaway. The hotel pools were quite cool but thanks to the roasting summer the sea was very warm and a great place to snorkel, feeding and viewing the local fish. The pizza oven and bar on the beach are excellent and helped transport us to states of utmost relaxation. There are water sports, volleyball and pétanque in case you get bored of swimming. 

We hired a car for four days which proved to be a good call- we didn’t go far but the drive to the hill top acropolis at Lindos is well worth it and the natural beauty of the “Seven Springs” is also highly recommended. 

Now we are back home- we are so grateful for our ten days of Rhodes sunshine and hospitality. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making this such a memorable holiday. I hope you all have a well deserved break at the end of a long and stressful season- you deserve it. My thoughts are with those locals whose homes have been decimated by the forest fires. 
In summary, this hotel is designed for families and it succeeds mightily  in providing a safe, friendly and welcoming environment. I think some reviews of Rodos Village expect it to be something it is not (Mitsis have other hotels which cater for different demographics). 
Well done everyone involved.
data.title: A memorable family holiday

data.text:
Not usually one to review but we have just got home from a fabulous 2 week stay. 
It’s one of the best holidays we’ve had. 
My other half wasn’t a fan of all inclusive holidays but he’s converted. 
Firstly the bar and entrainment staff are amazing…. Thank you!  Our 8 and 15 year old both enjoyed the shows daily. 
There’s so much food.  Lots of choice.  We’ve never eaten so well.  Amazing salad bar, fresh fish, lovely fruit. 
We didn’t have to queue at the pool bar or the amphitheater at all for drinks. 
The staff work so hard.  The hotel was always clean and tidy.  Rooms cleaned daily.  Mini bar filled every 2 days. 
Just prepare to queue at the day and night bars, but that’s literally our one and only negative.  Between the hotel busy times (around 7-9pm) we just took a stroll over the road to the 2 beautiful cocktail bars Mosa Beach Bar and Lythos, both with amazing sea views!  
The hotel beach bar and pizzas on the beach are perfect 👌🏻
The island is so beautiful.  The bus stop is right outside the hotel.  Lindos is lovely and only 15-20 mins on the bus.  
The water sports on the beach are such fun!! 
You can take a speed boat out which we all loved (prices on the app) well worth it!! 
There’s no rush in this hotel, it’s very chilled out (once you get your head around that, and away from our ‘everything needs to be now’ mentality it’s great 😀). 
100% going back next year!  Thank you for a brilliant holiday.
data.title: Brilliant Family Holiday!

data.text:
For all those worried about negative reviews, fear not! We had a wonderful holiday and we are quite fussy; I was so worried beforehand and I really wish I hadn’t expended so much needless energy reading negative reviews. It’s not perfect and it’s not five stars, but value for money people! It’s excellent for that. 

Food is very good. As others have said, book in advance. Asian and Italian in particular are sensational. Staff are simply lovely. My daughter was stung by a jelly fish (very rare by the way) and they put on cream and made her a drink, and she was soon better. The snorkelling is great. Tip - go to the further beach where there are fewer people. A lot of marine life - we saw a lion fish and a moray eel! We loved our room, which was a family suite. Definitely worth paying a little extra, as you get two little rooms. We were 512, which is a little noisy after entertainment spills out at 11pm but nothing too much (kids slept through). Acrobats and magic show very good, though we didn’t do much else (as kids’ activities are quite late). Recommend bus to Lindos and glass bottom boat ride. 

Yes there are queues for drinks, about ten minutes. Get over it. The staff work double jobs all season and are exhausted, and still had the energy to be kind and helpful in the last week of the year. I am sure we are able to wait for a cocktail. We didn’t much like the big pool, partly due to the behaviour of some other guests. We saw one guest scream (literally shout!) in the face of a lovely waiter because he happened to serve someone else before her in the burger queue! Actually made him cry. Most guests are a delight, and our kids made friends, but some definitely deserve one star for politeness and humility (and could do with cutting back on the all-in booze)! Salt pool much more chilled atmosphere. 

Parts of the hotel are a bit dated, but for what we paid we were thrilled. All our drinks were delicious, as were added bonuses likes crepes, pizza, Souvlaki, etc. Wish we were still there!
data.title: Ignore negative reviews! We loved it
